title: IMAP - Disk space is not released when I uncheck "keep for offline usage"
creator: gplus4096
content:
Hello everyone, I've a question about (local) disk space for IMAP accounts. I have an IMAP account; at the beginning I've checked in "Synchronization & Storage" the flag "Keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer". After a while, after I had received many emails, I've unchecked this; I was expecting the disk space occupied by the account to be released, but it didn't happen. I've also checked in the "Advanced" button, just below the flag "Keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer", that every single folder is NOT checked for offline use.

How can I recover my disk space without losing any email?

Thanks in advance

content:

When I create a new email message, the signature appears as: - correct text (after the change I made) - the frame of the desired photo, but not the photo, only descripiton text instead

I tried to do that with completely new folder and new html file and photo, same result.

I guess, the url to the image is obviously correct, because when I link to html with signature and photo of logo and me - face in suit, the result is correct text and the frame in the correct size, the description text "a person in suit), and when I link to html where is no face, just a logo, then again same result, correct text, correcxt size of the photo, but only description: The content of the picture is: alhpabet, row, design - "the description has been created autoamtically".

Does anybody know what to do with it please?

Thank You

title: Alfiókok
creator: zfgrg5hwym
content: A postafiókomon (icloud) belül létrehoztam további alfiókokat,. Beállítva s zűrőket, a beérkező leveleket a megadott szabály szerint szétosztja, vagyis áthelyezi a megjelölt alfiókba. Sajnos a Thunderbird alatt ezek az alfiókok nem jelennek meg. Csak a beérkezett üzenet mappa látható (valamint a kuka, a piszkozat, stb) de a többi már nem, így az oda áthelyezett leveleket nem is tudom olvasni. Kérdésem: milyen beállítást kellene használnom, hogy láthatóak legyenek az almappák. Köszönettel, Fefe

title: Cannot open .docx attachments with Libre Office
creator: rolf_m
content:
Sorry, not finding anything about this issue, and I honestly don't know if the issue is Settings, or Upgrade &c. Here's the thing:

Recent upgrade to Ubuntu 24.04. Snap version of Thunderbird (very problematic migration). It's working now, but because data was lost, and settings all re-set to zero with the Snap edition, there's been quite a bit of re-customizing &c. Here's the latest:

Someone sends me an e-mail with a .docx attachment, a daily occurence. Try to open it with Libre Office, as I have been doing for twenty years, including Open Office. But Libre Office does not show up as a helper app. Can't be selected from the right click menu. Or .. . ? Maybe I'm missing something, some new way of doing the same old thing.

When I go into settings and navigate down to Files and Attachments, I'm expecting a list of applications, and attendant actions. However, there's only a single line, for .pdf attachments. I don't see any button or facility enabling the user to add an application, and specify what happen when, for instance, you click on a .docx attachment.

And yes, Libre Office *is* installed, I've been using it regularly.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:135.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/135.0

title: Current Thunderbird Version is a Disaster for Outlook import
creator: safox.2021
content:
This is not a question. It is a statement of issues. I recently bought a new computer and tried to install Thunderbird on my new system. The installation went fine. The setup was one problem after another. Thunderbird required multiple attempts to connect with Outlook and sync my account. Next, I tried to import my contacts. Thunderbird failed numerous attempts to sync contacts. I finally had to manually import my contacts. Then spent an hour manually cleaning up my contacts. Thunderbird seems to have randomly assigned field names. (Names imported as numbers or dates) In addition, it imported contacts without associated data. (No email address, phone numbers etc.) After all that, Thunderbird would not allow me to use any of the contacts. The address book is there, the contacts are there, but it would not reference the address book when I tried to send an email. I had to go to the address book, copy the email and paste it into the to: field.

Next, I tried to create events and tasks. First problem, all calendars were disabled by default and no option was offered to enable the calendars. I spent another 45 min. trying to find a setting or something to enable the calendars. When I finally got them enabled, I spent another hour trying to get Thunderbird to create events and tasks. Thunderbird will not create either. I spent far more time than is rational to create each event and task. When I completed each attempt, Thunderbird trashed them. No event or task was ever created. At this point I uninstalled Thunderbird and wrote it off as a bad idea.

Folks, I am not new to this. I have been using similar apps since their early days. I know how to install and setup these apps. I am very familiar with the problems that may be encountered. And this far worse than anything I have seen in a long time. I do not know what is going on at Mozilla, but they have got some serious problems to work out. I will steer clear of Thunderbird for now.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0

title: Problem with Native Tray Icon in Thunderbird 136 on Linux - How to Remove It?
creator: ggwiazdor
content:
Hello, I recently updated Thunderbird to version 136 on my Linux system (Solus with Budgie desktop), and I noticed that a native tray icon now appears in my system tray. This was not the case with previous versions, where Thunderbird would run without placing an icon in the tray. The issue is that Thunderbird now shows an icon in the system tray, and I would like to disable it. I have already tried the following methods:

1. Editing the prefs.js file to set: `user_pref("mail.ui.showTrayIcon", false);` But this did not remove the icon.

2. Checking Thunderbird's settings for any option to disable the tray icon, but I could not find anything that addresses this behavior.

3. I have also checked the system tray settings in the Budgie desktop, but the icon still persists.

Is there any way to completely remove this tray icon in version 136? Is this a known issue with this release?

Any help would be appreciated!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/134.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/thunderbird-matrix-chat-faq"]
